comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Mistranslated, this is actually Portovenere near La Spezia. From 1897.

comment.author: 46431691@N08
comment._content: I confirm trialsanderrors' post. In the close up Portovenere Channel. Below Palmaria Island, above Portovenere, with, on the left, St. Peter church.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
trialsanderrors and Enrica_SP:

Thank you for pointing out the correct name for this beautiful place.  The photochrom itself does indicate this is Porto Venere. The name in the title came from the original catalogue produced by the Detroit Publishing Company, the creators and distributors of these images.  They definitely did get the translation wrong, since Venere = Venus, not Venice!  

We will correct the record when we update.
